articles.title: Trump to visit Kentucky ahead of November elections
articles.description: FRANKFORT, Ky. (AP) — President Donald Trump plans to campaign in Kentucky ahead of the midterm elections.

articles.title: West Virginia House speaker resigns to run for Supreme Court
articles.description: CHARLESTON, W.Va. (AP) — Republican West Virginia House Speaker Tim Armstead says he has resigned to run for a vacant seat on the state Supreme Court.

articles.title: Shiprock man gets 13 years in prison in stabbing death
articles.description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — A Shiprock man who pleaded guilty to fatally stabbing a woman in his home on the Navajo Nation is going to prison.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Recent Kansas editorials
articles.description: The Lawrence Journal-World, Aug. 20

articles.title: Woman dies after falling off SUV
articles.description: NAVARRE, Fla. (AP) — Authorities say a Texas woman died after falling off the side of an SUV in Florida.

articles.title: Kelly Marie Tran breaks silence about online harassment
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Kelly Marie Tran is breaking her silence about online harassment months after deleting her Instagram account.

articles.title: Sioux Falls man pleads guilty to pimping charges
articles.description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D. (AP) — A Sioux Falls man has pleaded guilty to pimping and prostitution charges in federal court.

articles.title: Prosecutor's death penalty stance offends Vatican official
articles.description: CINCINNATI (AP) — A Vatican official has encouraged an Ohio prosecutor to go to confession after defying the Catholic Church's new policy that the death penalty is never acceptable.

articles.title: Koch group spends $1.8 million in ads for Wisconsin's Walker
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A conservative advocacy group funded by the billionaire Koch brothers is launching a $1.8 million ad buy for Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker.

articles.author: By BEN NADLER
articles.title: Bid to create new city in Georgia triggers a federal lawsuit
articles.description: STOCKBRIDGE, Ga. (AP) — Lawyers representing Stockbridge, Georgia, have filed a federal lawsuit claiming a plan to carve off part of that city to create a new, wealthier city is unconstitutional.

articles.title: United Utah hopeful gets nod from ex-contenders in 2 parties
articles.description: OGDEN, Utah (AP) — A northern Utah candidate for a new centrist third-party has picked up some endorsements from former Democratic and Republican contenders.

articles.title: University of Missouri sees hopeful sign in enrollment stats
articles.description: COLUMBIA, Mo. (AP) — The University of Missouri's flagship campus in Columbia has recorded its lowest total enrollment in more than a decade, but a surge of freshmen has officials encouraged that the school appears poised to move past the…

articles.title: Idaho rejected for Women's Business Center grant
articles.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — Idaho will continue to be one of the only states in the nation without a Women's Business Center.

articles.author: By KATHLEEN FOODY Associated Press
articles.title: Man admits wife's murder, blames her for daughters' deaths
articles.description: DENVER (AP) — A Colorado man is due back in court Tuesday to formally learn that he has been charged with the murders of his pregnant wife and two daughters.

articles.title: Judge orders release of Arkansas attorney general's records
articles.description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) — A judge has ordered the public release of a portion of Arkansas Attorney General Leslie Rutledge's past personnel record ahead of the November election.

articles.title: Massachusetts raises risk level for West Nile virus
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — Massachusetts health officials have taken the rare step of increasing the statewide risk level for West Nile virus.

articles.author: By BECKY BOHRER Associated Press
articles.title: Primaries for governor, US House top Alaska ballot
articles.description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska (AP) — Primaries for governor and U.S. House top the ticket in Alaska Tuesday.

articles.author: By JULIE CARR SMYTH Associated Press
articles.title: Agents with expired vests vented, prepared for 'misfortune'
articles.description: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Ohio Bureau of Criminal Investigation agents and supervisors raised repeated concerns about expired body armor for more than a year before a union grievance was filed this May, public records show.
